question: In which nation "Stari Grad Plain" is located?
explanation: Stari Grad Plain is a cultural landscape on the island of Hvar in the Adriatic Sea of Croatia. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. This fertile plain was first colonized by Ionian Greeks to use it for agriculture during the 4th century B.C. This plain are better suited for Olives and Grapes cultivation. This natural reserves houses ancient stone walls and shelters. This Palin is the best example of the ancient geometrical system of land division used by the ancient Greeks.
